Another issue (1 of many) I have with the Dems’ support of the ACA is the lie they spread that you can sign-up for insurance whenever you have the need. That is blatantly false. Individuals can only sign-up during open enrollment which only runs for a couple of weeks each yr.

One big change I've advocated for is to bring health insurers under the umbrella of US anti-trust laws. How can we expect lower premiums if these companies are exempt from anti-trust laws (which are in place for good reason & cover virtually every other industry in our country)?

I got a little heated this week when my Democratic colleagues suggested that the Affordable Care Act (ACA) is good as-is and doesn't need any major changes to better help the American people. That couldn't be further from the truth, and they know it.
